intro: Schmidelia leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stalked schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Schmidelia leptostachya is known for its delicate foliage and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
